duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide ongoing leadership to ensure high-quality patient care and the development of employees and services to meet the clinic's vision.
Act as a liaison between staff and customers/community, and collaborate with administrators to implement new processes and procedures.
Maintain a staff of sufficient number to effectively provide quality care for patients of all ages, including interviewing, hiring, and training new staff.
Remain current on research and trends impacting professionals and services, and new developments.
Collaborate with operations manager and support personnel to address building/environment needs, and participate in marketing activities to promote referrals and team culture.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an approved school of Occupational Therapy or Speech-language Pathology, and currently licensed in WA in Occupational Therapy or Speech-Language Pathology. A minimum of three to five years of clinical experience with at least one year of supervisory experience is required.
